Isaiah or Isaias__48.1: Hear ye these things, O house of Jacob, you that are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Juda, you who swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth, nor in justice.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.2: For they are called of the holy city, and are established upon the God of Israel: the Lord of hosts is his name.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.3: The former things of old I have declared, and they went forth out of my mouth, and I have made them to be heard: I did them suddenly and they came to pass.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.4: For I knew that thou art stubborn, and thy neck is as an iron sinew, and thy forehead as brass.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.5: I foretold thee of old, before they came to pass I told thee, lest thou shouldst say: My idols have done these things, and my graven and molten things have commanded them.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.6: See now all the things which thou hast heard: but have you declared them? I have shewn thee new things from that time, and things are kept which thou knowest not:
Isaiah or Isaias__48.7: They are created now, and not of old: and before the day, when thou heardest them not, lest thou shouldst say: Behold I knew them.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.8: Thou hast neither heard, nor known, neither was thy ear opened of old. For I know that transgressing thou wilt transgress, and I have called thee a transgressor from the womb.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.9: For my name's sake I will remove my wrath far off: and for my praise I will bridle thee, lest thou shouldst perish.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.10: Behold I have refined thee, but not as silver, I have chosen thee in the furnace of poverty.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.11: For my own sake, for my own sake will I do it, that I may not be blasphemed: and I will not give my glory to another.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.12: Hearken to me, O Jacob, and thou Israel whom I call: I am he, I am the first, and I am the last.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.13: My hand also hath founded the earth, and my right hand hath measured the heavens: I shall call them, and they shall stand together.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.14: Assemble yourselves together, all you, and hear: who among them hath declared these things? the Lord hath loved him, he will do his pleasure in Babylon, and his arm shall be on the Chaldeans.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.15: I, even I have spoken and called him: I have brought him, and his way is made prosperous.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.16: Come ye near unto me, and hear this: I have not spoken in secret from the beginning: from the time before it was done, I was there, and now the Lord God hath sent me, and his spirit.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.17: Thus saith the Lord thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: I am the Lord thy God that teach thee profitable things, that govern thee in the way that thou walkest.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.18: O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments: thy peace had been as a river, and thy justice as the waves of the sea,
Isaiah or Isaias__48.19: And thy seed had been as the sand, and the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof: his name should not have perished, nor have been destroyed from before my face.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.20: Come forth out of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, declare it with the voice of joy: make this to be heard, and speak it out even to the ends of the earth. Say: The Lord hath redeemed his servant Jacob.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.21: They thirsted not in the desert, when he led them out: he brought forth water out of the rock for them, and he clove the rock, and the waters gushed out.
Isaiah or Isaias__48.22: There is no peace to the wicked, saith the Lord.
